9 Theming

The Egeo Base Framework was built thinking in theming from the first time. All components provides a series of properties with default values that can be changed using Sass.

9.1 How to create a theme

To create a theme the only thing you must to do is to create a Sass part file and include all the properties you want to customize and are provided by the component. The ones you don't include in the file will be replaced by the default value ones.

It is also possible, and even advisable, to create an own micro-architecture for the theme if it is too complex to be included in one unique file.

Note: Note that when we are talking about components to theme, we are talking about [CSS Base Framework Components(section-7.html) and not the UI Kit Components. The difference is that they are a different set of components. The UI Kit Components were built using several CSS Components.

Creating a theme

The best way to create a theme is creating a new file inside the /theme/ folder, called _themes.mythemename.scss. The underscore is to indicate that is a Sass part file, and the rest is a convention naming.

Inside the file we can begin to create our theme customizing the values provided by the components. For example:

$egeo-c-label---background: transparent;
$egeo-c-label---border: 0;
$egeo-c-label---box-shadow: none;
$egeo-c-label---color: egeo-get-color(a1);
$egeo-c-label---font-size: egeo-get-font-size(body_xxsmall);
$egeo-c-label---font-style: null;

$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---color: egeo-get-color(a1);
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---content: '(optional)';
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---font-style: null;

$egeo-c-label__icon---color: egeo-get-color(n5);
$egeo-c-label__icon---font-size: egeo-get-font-size(body_xsmall);

If we want to create a complex architecture for the theme, we should remember that we want to use @import directive.

@import '/mythemename/label';
@import '/mythemename/header';
@import '/mythemename/icon';
...

How to import a theme inside the Egeo Base Framework

To import the theme inside Egeo to be applied, is needed to do it just after the tools, importing it as is shown below:

@import 'tools/tools.log';

@import 'settings/settings';
@import 'settings/settings.colors';
@import 'settings/settings.fonts';
@import 'settings/settings.layers';
@import 'settings/settings.icons';
@import 'settings/settings.typography';

@import 'tools/tools.log';
@import 'tools/tools.maps';
@import 'tools/tools.colors';
@import 'tools/tools.typography';
@import 'tools/tools.layers';

@import 'themes/theme.mythemename';

@import 'utils/utils.alignments';
@import 'utils/utils.clearfix';
@import 'utils/utils.floats';
@import 'utils/utils.text';

@import 'objects/media/objects.media';
@import 'objects/box-shadow/objects.box-shadow';

@import 'components/component/components.component';
@import 'components/app/components.app';
...

How to import a theme inside an external project

If you have a project based in Egeo components and want to create a theme to be used by the Egeo components, basically, the way to do it is exactly the same than the before one shown. The only thing to keep in mind is that the paths used to import the Egeo Base Framework files would come from /node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/... instead the theme that you probably want to be in your own project and then come from /sass/mytheme/_mytheme.scss. Take a look to the sample below:

$egeo-fontface-src: '/assets/fonts';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/vendors/vendors.sanitize';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings.colors';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings.fonts';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings.icons';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings.typography';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/settings/settings.layers';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/tools/tools.log';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/tools/tools.maps';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/tools/tools.layers';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/tools/tools.colors';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/tools/tools.typography';

@import 'theme/egeoapptheme/theme.egeoapptheme';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/utils/utils.alignments';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/utils/utils.floats';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/utils/utils.text';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/utils/utils.clearfix';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/objects/media/objects.media';
@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/objects/box-shadow/objects.box-shadow';

@import '../../node_modules/egeo.ui.base/dist/egeo/components/component/components.component';
...
